intro: Senecio fadyenii var. dolichanthus, commonly known as the long-flowered Senecio, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish to greenish flowers. Its leaves are typically linear and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or dry landscapes.
